tokens.description: List of tokens created from document's text.

positions.description: List of tokens' positions represented by bounding boxes. The i-th element of the list indicates the position of i-th token from the tokens array. Each position consists of four elements: [x1, y1, x2, y2], where x1 and x2 indicate the start and the end of a bounding box in the vertical dimension, whereas y1 and y2 indicate the start and the end of a bounding box in the horizontal dimension.

scores.description: List of OCR confidency scores, where i-th element of the list indicates the score of i-th token from tokens array, in other words, it shows confidence of the OCR engine that i-th element is equal to the i-th token.

structures.description: Information about pages and lines of text.

structure_value.description: Positions of tokens assigned to pages. The I-th list consists of a two-element array indicating ids of the first and the last token on i-th page. For example, structure_value [[0,150], [150, 300]] means that the first page consists of tokens from 0 to 149 from the tokens array and the second page consists of tokens from 150 to 299.

positions.description: List of bounding boxes for whole pages, first and third elements indicate the start and the end of a bounding box in the vertical dimension, whereas second and fourth elements describe start and end of a horizontal dimension.

structure_value.description: Positions of tokens assigned to lines of text. The i-th list consists of a two-element array indicating ids of the first and the last token in i-th line, by analogy with pages structure_values, [[0,10], [10, 15]] means that the first line consists of tokens from 0 to 9 from the tokens array and the second line consists of tokens from 10 to 15.

positions.description: List of bounding boxes covering whole lines, first and third elements indicate the start and the end of a bounding box in the vertical dimension, whereas second and fourth elements describe start and end of a horizontal dimension.
